unnormalised: Rental Agreements: Know Your Rights, Yaar!
normalised: Rental Agreements: Know Your Rights, Friend!

unnormalised: Mumbai - Forget the Bollywood drama, the real rollercoaster is finding a decent rental agreement, right? Property prices are soaring, and finding a good flat is tough enough. Don't get bamboozled by sneaky clauses!
normalised: Mumbai - Forget the Bollywood drama, the real rollercoaster is finding a decent rental agreement, right? Property prices are soaring, and finding a good flat is tough enough. Don't get bamboozled by sneaky clauses!

unnormalised: Experts at Dr. Ambedkar Institute of Real Estate Studies are urging tenants to *actually read* their rental agreements. Seriously. Know your rights, especially regarding maintenance. Landlord trying to fob off plumbing issues on you? Not cool.
normalised: Experts at D R dot Ambedkar Institute of Real Estate Studies are urging tenants to *actually read* their rental agreements. Seriously. Know your rights, especially regarding maintenance. Landlord trying to fob off plumbing issues on you? Not cool.

unnormalised: Watch out for excessive security deposits! While Rs. 50,000 might be standard in some areas, anything beyond that is suspicious. Also, clarify who's responsible for repainting.
normalised: Watch out for excessive security deposits! While rupee fifty thousand might be standard in some areas, anything beyond that is suspicious. Also, clarify who's responsible for repainting.

unnormalised: Many agreements these days include clauses about pets and late-night parties. So, if you're planning on hosting a Diwali bash, make sure it's cool with the landlord.
normalised: Many agreements these days include clauses about pets and late-night parties. So, if you're planning on hosting a Diwali bash, make sure it's cool with the landlord.

unnormalised: Got a place with 600 sq ft of space? Lucky you! But remember, your rental agreement is your bible. Protect yourself, and happy house hunting! Also, ensure the agreement explicitly covers the advance amount and the lock-in period, if any. Don’t get caught in a legal chakravyuh later!
normalised: Got a place with six hundred square feet of space? Lucky you! But remember, your rental agreement is your bible. Protect yourself, and happy house hunting! Also, ensure the agreement explicitly covers the advance amount and the lock-in period, if any. Don’t get caught in a legal chakravyuh later!
